Sentencas: In recent years, fuel cell technology has attracted considerable attention from several fields of scientific research as fuel cells produce electric energy with high efficiency, emit little noise, and are non-polluting.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are particularly important for stationary applications due to their high operating temperature (1,073-1,273 K).
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Methane appears to be a fuel of great interest for SOFC systems because it can be directly converted into hydrogen by direct internal reforming (DIR) within the SOFC anode.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Unfortunately, internal steam reforming in SOFC leads to inhomogeneous temperature distributions which can result in mechanical failure of the cermet anode.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: Moreover this concept requires a large amount of steam in the fed gas.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: To avoid these problems, gradual internal reforming (GIR) can be used.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: GIR is based on local coupling between steam reforming and hydrogen oxidation.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: The steam required for the reforming reaction is obtained by the hydrogen oxidation.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: However, with GIR, Boudouard and cracking reactions can involve a risk of carbon formation.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: To cope with carbon formation a new cell configuration of SOFC electrolyte support was studied.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: This configuration combined a catalyst layer (0.1%Ir-CeO2) with a classical anode, allowing GIR without coking.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: In order to optimise the process a SOFC model has been developed, using the CFD-Ace+ software package, and including a thin electrolyte.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: The impact of a thin electrolyte on previous conclusions has been assessed.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: As predicted, electrochemical performances are higher and carbon formation is always avoided.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance

Sentencas: However a sharp decrease in the electrochemical performances appears at high current densities due to steam clogging.
Titulo: SOFC fuelled by methane without coking: optimization of electrochemical performance
